title: FS/FT: T-206 Rare Variations (including Pied 350 Lundgren - Chicago) & Horizontal poses
author: Archive

posts.post_title: FS/FT: T-206 Rare Variations (including Pied 350 Lundgren - Chicago) & Horizontal poses
posts.post_content:
Posted By: E. Angyal
Thought I'd offer this group of tougher T-206s to the Net54 board first.  If there isn't enough interest in them at this time (they are currently ungraded), I will submit them to SGC at the Strongsville show in mid April.  All cards are very clean with nice color and no creases or wrinkles.  Some are vg/ex (Elberfeld, Lundgren), some are ex or ex+ (Dahlen, Browne, Kleinow). If you want, we can also work out a deal where the sales are contingent upon them coming back from SGC with a minimum grade that we mutually agree upon.  

The Lundgren (Chicago) card is one of the 5 cards reported in Ted Z's population report of Lungrens with a Piedmont 350 back (I purchased it from Charles Conlon about 6 years ago) - its pretty rare with this back.

Higher resolution (400 dpi) scans are available upon request.  

Please email me at EANGYAL@roadrunner.com if you have any questions.  

I will respond to emails in the order that they are recieved.  First one to email me with "I'll take such and such" gets the card(s).  All prices already include insured shipping.  If you buy multiple cards, I will give you a break on the shipping costs and reduce the total slightly.  Asking prices are shown on the scans.  I'd also consider trading these for Old Judges that I want.  Thanks for looking, 

Eric 
[IMG]http://i660.photobucket.com/albums/uu328/EricAngyal01/T206-Vertical5-40.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i660.photobucket.com/albums/uu328/EricAngyal01/T206-Horizontal5-40.jpg[/IMG]

Also see my other items for sale on BST.
